urls.title: BBC Two - Great British Railway Journeys, Series 13, Dagenham to Battersea
urls.description: Michael tracks the River Thames from east to west with his 1930s Bradshaw‚Äôs guide.

text:
RT @EnvAgencySE: üì∫WATCH: https://t.co/7FWsthcYrF

THIS Thursday - 27 May, at 6.30pm on #BBC2 and @bbciplayer

We welcome Michael Portillo a‚Ä¶

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Great British Railway Journeys
entity.description: Cartographer George Bradshaw produced the first comprehensive timetable and travel guide of Great Britain's railway system in 1840. Armed with his Bradshaw's Guide, presenter Michael Portillo travels around the country by train exploring the ways that society and industry have changed since the guide was first published during the Victorian era. In each destination Michael visits local landmarks, meets residents, enjoys local food, and tries his hand at local crafts and manufacture, and considers the legacy of the industrial revolution as he makes he way across the country.
